meanings.definition: To cause someone to adopt radical positions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The group's extreme views were radicalising young individuals.
meanings.sent2: She was worried about her brother radicalising after joining the new political movement.
meanings.sent3: The idea of radicalising a cat to only eat vegetables is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His passion for environmental conservation was radicalising his entire lifestyle.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fiery speech radicalising the crowd stayed with her for days.

meanings.sent1: The radicalising of the community led to increased tensions.
meanings.sent2: She studied the radicalising of individuals in different social contexts.
meanings.sent3: The radicalising of the squirrels in the park made for an interesting observation.
meanings.sent4: The radicalising of the colors in the painting created a striking visual impact.
meanings.sent5: The gradual radicalising of his beliefs was evident in his changing actions.
